intro: Lathyrus nevadensis var. parkeri, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada vetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial legume characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant produces small, lens-shaped pods that contain several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
